p: We divided the study area into two regions: The first one ( M) is the area containing all occurrence records of the species and also includes the priority areas for its conservation, according to the Brazilian Ministry of the Environment (Portaria N° 19, of March 9, 2016—ICMBio). M extends between the states of Ceará and Espírito Santo in Brazil [ 37, 40]. The second region ( G’) comprises the entire coastal zone of the Southwestern Atlantic Ocean, from the intertidal zone down to 100 m deep [ 44]. The model was calibrated in M and the potential habitat for the late 21st century was projected in G' ( Fig 1).
